1 History of Thailand

2 Thailand is located at Latitude 13 ํ 44 ํN and Longitude 100 ํ30 ํ E

Located in Southeast Asia

3 The Kingdom of Thailand

The kingdom of Thailand lies in the heart of Southeast Asia, making it a natural gateway to Indochina, Myanmar and Southern China. Its shape and geography divide into four natural regions : the mountains and forests of the North; the vast rice fields of the Central Plains; the semi-arid farm lands of the Northeast plateau; and the tropical islands and long coastline of the peninsula South

4 The Origin of Thais There are many different opinions or theory about the origins of Thais. Originated in Northwestern Szechuan or Yunnan in China Drawn from research done in Kwangtung, Kwangsi and Yunnan where is Thai Language still spoken. From Central of China Originated here in Thailand and later scattered to various part of Asia

5 Early Kingdoms Early history of Thailand Initial states of Thailand BCE–1238) Suvarnabhumi Central Thailand Dvaravati Lavo Northern Thailand Yonok Singhanavati Hariphunchai Southern Thailand Langkasuka Srivijaya Tambralinga

6 Sukhothai 13th-15th Century

“ The dawn or the rising of happiness” * Por Khun Bang Klang Thao (Hao) the governor of Bang Yang and Por Khun Pha Muang the governor of Rad joined hand to crush the khmer rule. * Por Khun Bang Klang Hao declared independence in 1238 and was announced himself as king of Sukhothai name “Si Intrathit”

7 Sukhothai King Si inthrathit and queen “Nang Suang” have 3 sons

The eldest was died when he was young The 2nd was Ban Muang The 3rd was Ram Khamhang who became the 3rd King of Sukhothai

8 The Kings of Sukhothai King Pho Khun Sri Indraditya (1238- 1257)

King Pho Khun Ban Muang ( ) King Pho Khun Ramkhamhaeng (Ramkhamhaeng the Great) (ruled or 1317) (called Rammaraj in the Ayutthaya chronicles) * King Pu Phraya Si Songklam: After Ramkhamheang's death, ruled temporarily in absence of Loethai who was on trip to China. He was not styled Pho Khun. (Not counted as a King)

9 The Kings of Sukhothai King Pho Khun Loeithai (1298 - 1347)

King Pho Khun Nguanamthom (1347) King Phya Lithai or Thammaracha I ( /1374) King Thammaracha II or Phya Leuthai (1368/ ) King Thammaracha III or Phya Saileuthai ( ) King Thammaracha IV ( )

10 King Ramkhamhang The 3rd son of King Sri Inthrathit

He ruled the kingdom with justice and great generosity to his people with the characteristic of a paternal government He invented the first Thai alphabet in 1283 by used the Mon and Khmer scripts which had been taken from Indian scripts as the basis of his alphabets.

11 King Ramkhamhang On one of his stone inscriptions it says

“This Sukhothai is good. In the water there are fish. In the fields there is rice. The king doest not levy rate at his people. Who wants to trade in elephants trades. Who wants to trade in horses, trades. Who wants to trade in gold and silver, trades. The faces of the people shine bright.”

12 King Maha Thammaracha I (Lithai)( 1346-1374)

Who was remarkable for his religious piety. He made a high monk a Sangkharacha (Supreme patriarch) He set an example to his people by becoming a monk for a short time that was followed by Kings of Ayutthaya and King of the Chakri Dynasty. It became the custom for Thai young men aged 21 to enter the monkhood for at least a short period.

13 King Maha Thammaracha I (Lithai)( 1346-1374)

Composed a book on Buddhist cosmology called “Tribhumikatha or Tribhum Phra Ruang( The three worlds – Heaven/Earth and Hell) Making the Master Buddha image “Phra Puhttha Chinnarat” at Si Rattana Mahathat Temple in Phitsanulok.

14 The Fall of Sukhothai After death of King Ramkhamhang, the Sukhothai tributaries broke away; (Uttaradit, Luang Prabang, Vientian, Mon, Tak, Supanburi). Sukhothai was quickly reduce the former power. Meanwhile since 1350 Ayuthaya was started the kingdom and rose in strength. Finally in 1378 King Thammaracha II had do submit to the power of Ayuthaya. Sukhothai Kingdom did not die a quick death. It’s decline lasted from the mid 14th century until 15th century.

15 Buddha Image in Sukhothai Style

Characteristics of the image “ A flame appeared on top of the head of the Buddha. The face is in the oval shape with the fine carving eyebrows. Eyes a bit open and downward gaze. Overall displays a gentle smiling expression. The Four postures of the buddha (sitting, standing, walking, reclining were created) Sukhothai religions art was influenced by Sri Lanka art

16 Lotus Bud Stupa It is a very distinctive type of chedi found only in the towns that made up the inner provinces of the Sukhothai Kingdom such as Sukhothai, Kamphaeng Phet, Phetchabun and Phitsanulok. It was simply emerged by an amalgamation of various contemporary art styles into a new style of a stupa, which become a common symbol of the Sukhothai community.

17 Lotus Bud Stupa Estimated to have been built in the second half of the 14th century Commonly called the Lotus-Bud Tower due to the distinctive shape of the top; its proper name is phum khao bin.

18 Ayudhaya Kingdom Existed from (417 years)until it was invaded by the Burmese King Uthong moved the capital from Suphanburi or Uthong to the south to escape the threat of an epidemic. “Ayothaya” was settle before, and he founded a new capital, which he called “Ayuthaya” meaning the city of kings.

19 King Uthong King Ramathibodi I

He was the first king of the kingdom “Ayuthaya” reigning from He was born in 1314 and known as Prince Uthong before ascended to the throne on March 4, 1350 Possible to be related with “Lavo” Kingdom Derived his name from Rama; the god Vishnu's reincarnation and the hero of Indian epic “Ramayana”

20 King Uthong King Ramathibodi I

During his reign the government adopted the form of an autocrat or absolute monarchy with strong Cambodian influences. His autocracy was moderated by the observance of the ten Buddhist Kingly Duties. ( Todsaphit Ratchatam ) King Uthong died in 1369 and his son “Ramesuan” mounted the throne.

21 Ayudhaya Kingdom Reign with 33 Kings from 5 Royal Dynasties Uthong

Suphannaphum Sukhothai Prasathong Ban Phu Luang

Prasat Thong Dynasty ( ) Prasat Thong (Sanphet V) ( ) Chao Fa Chai (Sanphet VI) (1655) Si Suthammaracha (Sanphet VII) (1655) Narai, the Great ( )

Ban Phlu Luang Dynasty ( ) Phet Racha ( ) Luang Sorasak or Phrachao Sua ('The Tiger King') (Sanphet VIII) ( ) Tai Sa (Sanphet IX) ( ) Borommakot (Borommaracha Thirat III) ( ) Uthumphon (Borommaracha Thirat IV) (1758) Suriyamarin or Ekkathat (Borommaracha Thirat V) ( )

28 The 1st Fall of Ayuthaya In 1563 the successor of king Tabenshweti, King Burannong ascended the throne. Ayuthaya was reign by King mahachakraphat; Known as “Lord of the white elephant” and his queen Suriyothai. Appointed Khun Pirenthorathep as mahathammaraja to govern Phitsanulok

29 The 1st Fall of Ayuthaya Burmese King asked for 2 white elephants but King Mahachakraphat refused the request then Burmese King declared war in 1549. Queen Suriyothai was died in the war After 3 times serious combat with Burma, Thailand lost independence for the 1st time in 1569 in the reign of King Mahintharathirat

30 Queen Sri Suriyothai Means “Sunrise” Queen of King Mahachakapat

Legendary queen for having givine herlife in defense of her king (as her husband) In 2001; the movie “The legend of Suriyothai” was released”

31 King Naresuan or (Somdet Phra SanpetII)

He was born in Phitsanulok on 25 April, 1555 He was the son of King Maha Thammarachathirat with his queen wisutkasatri (Daughter of Mahachakrapat & Queen Sri Suriyothai) “Black Prince” Supankanlaya – Golden Princess Ekathatsarot – White Prince

32 King Naresuan In 1563 King Burannong, King of Angwa invaded Siam and Phitsanulok became a Burmese tributary. After the 1st Fall of Ayuthaya, King Naresuan stayed 7 years in Angwa as a hostage. In 1581 Burannong died and his son ascended the throne named “Nandaburan” In 1584; declaration in independence

33 End of Ayuthaya In 1758, King Ekkathat ascended to the throne

King Uthumphon was forced to abdicate Ayuthaya was in the weakness period The lack of preparation and military training On April 7, 1767 Ayuthaya fell into Burmese hands. They were cruel to the Thais , burnt the city and many treasures both of material and cultural were destroyed

34 Kingdom of Thonburi (1768-1782)

“Ayudhaya never lacks good man” Thonburi Dynasty ( ) Taksin, the Great (28 December April 1782) He was born in Thai-Chinese Family; Chinese father and Thai mother on 7th April 1734. The Samuhanayok adopted him and named him “Sin” which means money or property. When he was 13 years old he became a royal page.

35 Kingdom of Thonburi (1768-1782)

He was 3 years in monkhood from 20 years old. Rejoined the service of king Ekathat who appointed him as Luang Yokabat The governor of Tak known as “Phraya Tak” He was promoted to Phra wichienprakan, the governor of Kamphangphet.

36 Kingdom of Thonburi (1768-1782)

He was punished by King Ekathat because fired the cannon without the king’s permission. Before the fall of Ayuthaya; he made his way out of the city directed to Chanthaburi, (passes ; Nakornayok, Chonburi and Rayong.) “To take the town by dawn and to throw away all the food reserves because they would have to take their meals inside the town or starve”

37 Kingdom of Thonburi (1768-1782)

Came back to Ayuthaya after 7 months but too much was destroyed. Established Thonburi Kingdom in 1767 and ascended the throne named “King Taksin” In 1782 King Taksin was out of his mind, probably due to “the war strain and overwork arising from absolute rule” He was killed by his soldier due to he was the insane king. Thonburi was the capital for 15 Years.

38 The Rattanakosin Period 1782-present

Chakri Dynasty (1782-Present) Name Born - Died Reign start Reign end Buddha Yodfa Chulalok, the Great ( King Rama I) 6 April 1782 7 September 1809 Buddha Loetla Nabhalai (King Rama II) 21 July 1824 Jessadabodindra (King Rama III) 2 April 1851

41 The Rattanakosin Period Phraphutthayotfa Chulalok

The Great King Rama I "The Founder of Chakri Dynasty" Jao Phraya Chakri, or Rama I, was the first King of Thailand's current Chakri royal dynasty ( April 6, 1782;Coronation Day) He was born in 1736 and former name was “Thong Duang”

42 Phra Phutthayotfa Chulalok King Rama I

He entered the service of Phya Tak Sin and fought by his side in almost every campaign until the latter became King Tak Sin His first order of business was to move the capital across the river from Thonburi to the east of chaopraya river He built the Grand Palace complex of buildings, which included Wat Phra Kaeo to house the Emerald Buddha he captured from the Lao people in Vientiane. ( 3 years completed construction)

43 Restoration & Rebuilding King Rama I

Ruled as an absolute monarch,, with the ten kingly virtues. He devoted himself to a reorganization of the administration. The Buddhist hierarchy was reorganized. The Buddhis scripture of Tripitaka was revised.

44 Restoration & Rebuilding King Rama I

Built and restored many temples, including Wat Phra Chetuphon or Wat Pho. A commission of legal experts was set up to revise the laws and the result was the laws of Three Seals ( Kot Mai Tra Sam Duang) Composed some poem “Ramakien”( Thai version of Ramayana) and “Inao”

45 The Burmese Keep Trying King Rama I

“Nine Armies Wars” ( ) In 1785, nine Burmese armies totaling 144,000 men crossed into Siam at five different points,

46 King Buddha Lertla Naphalai Rama II (1783-1824)

King Rama I’s son. A great poet Golden age of Thai Literature. He wrote many epic poem for Thai classical drama, such as . “Sangthong” and also he collaborated with the other such as Sunthon Phu.

47 King Buddha Lertla Naphalai Rama II (1783-1824)

He restored and ordered many temples to be built. The most famous was Wat Arun (The Temple of Dawn. But Rama III replaced the 52 foot central prang by a tower 227 feet high And also shown his carving skill at the panel doors of the vihan (Prayer house) at Wat Suthat. It was a reign of emphasizing the cultural aspects of life and, perhaps, not facing the hard choices ( Peaceful )

48 Sunthon Phu Sunthon Phu (1786-1856) He was born in June 26, 1786

A favorite poet of King Rama II, because of his sharp wit and great artistic talents. Later Phu received the title of nobility as Khun Sunthonwohan. He is one of the great of Thai literature. Great poet for 4 Kingdoms (Rama I – IV) His Popular story, “Phra Apaimani”, is a romantic epic which tells the adventures and love affairs of a prince

49 Phra Nang Klao King Rama III

He was born as prince “Tub”(Prince Chesadabodin) on March 31, 1788. He was the son of King Rama II King of Trade and was called by his father “Chao Sua” The 1st Newspaper was set up “The Bangkok Recorder” by Dr. Dan Beach Bradley; an American Christian Missionary

50 Phra Nang Klao King Rama III

Most of temples were adored with porcelain pieces from China due to the Trade with China. Also order the pogoda from China to be built at Wat Yannawa in the shape of chinese boat. Made Wat Pho an institution of high education All the paintings and inscriptions were on small stone slabs and about many branches of study.

51 King Mongkut King Rama IV

He was in the monkhood for 27 years. Ascended the throne when he was 47 years old. Has a great knowledge of Budhism and developing the sect call Thammayut Nikaya. Modernrization of the kingdom with truly well equipped. Studied English from America Missionary 1st Asian Monarch who could understand, read and write English.

52 King Mongkut King Rama IV

Appointed Prince Chulamani, his younger brother, as second King name Phra Pinklao Expanded the construction of the Grand Palace Sir John Bowring and The Bowring’s Proposal; a treaty of friendship and commerce. Was interested in astronomy and astrology Solar Eclipse August 18, 1868 at tambol Wa kor, Prachuap Khirikhan Province He was died of Malaria after came back from Prachuap-Khirikhan for 6 weeks when he was 64 years old.

53 King Chulalongkorn Rama V

He was born on September 20, 1853. He ascended to the throne when he was 16 Years old. Manage to save siam from being colonized and all his reforms were for the survival in the midst of western colonialism. Was the 1st Thai King who visit Europe twice.( 1897 and 1907) As shown in “Saded Prapat Ton” mixed and talked informally with his people In 1905, he put out a law the abolition of slavery. This led to Thai people’s freedom.

54 King Mongkut King Rama V

The 1st railway line from Bangkok to Nakhon Ratchasima with the first section to Ayuthaya. Built The marbel temple “Wat Benchamaborphit” Construction of “Chulalongkorn Equesterian Statue” for celebrated 40 years anniversary of the king. During his lifetime had 92 Royal consorts with 72 children He died in October 23, 1910 of his kidney disease in Dusit Palace when he was 58 years old with reigned the Kingdom for 43 years old.

55 King Vajiravudh Rama VI

He was born on January 1, 1881 and ruling from 1910 as a 6th monarch of Chakri Dynasty. He was firstly educated in Royal Palace in Siamese and English and continued his education in Britain at the “Royal Military Academy sandhurst” Established Vajiravudh Colledge and Chulalongkorn University. In 1991, he established the scout order in Siam.

56 King Vajiravudh Rama VI

In 1912, announced the change of calendar usage from Rattanakosin Era to Buddhist Era. In 1914, Constructed Don Mueang Airport. In 1915, Constuction of Hua Lamphong Rail Station.

57 King Vajiravudh Rama VI

In 1914 –1918 World war I and promote “Siamese Nationalism” In July 1917, King Vajiravudh sided himself with the Allied Powers and changed the flag of Siam from the elephant banner to a Tri-colors. He died in November 25, 1925 when he was 46 years old and after his daughter only 1 day. His reign was 16 years long.

58 Thai Flag 1917- Present Aydhaya-1782 1916-1917 1855-1916

/Rama I / Rama IV

59 King Prajadhipok RamaVII (1925-1934)

He was born on November 8, 1893 Ascended to the throne on November 21, 1925 Last absolute Monarch Revolution on June 24, The 1st permanent constitution was Promulgated on December 10, 1932 The 1st constitutional monarch

60 King Prajadhipok RamaVII (1925-1934)

March 2, 1935, King Prajadhipok abdicated and to be replaced by King Ananda Mahidol After abdication, he spent the rest of his life in England with queen Ramphaiphanni Built The Memorial Bridge ;The bridge was opened on April 6, 1932, commemorating the 150th anniversary of the Chakri Dynasty. Built the Sala Chaloem Krung (Chaloem Krung Royal Theatre)

61 King Ananda Mahidol Rama VIII (1934-1946)

was born in Heidelberg, Germany ,, September 20,1925. He was the first son of Prince Mahidol Adulyadej of Songkhla (son of King Chulalongkorn) On March 2, 1935 Prince Ananda Mahidol was elected by the Thai parliament and government to succeed his uncle, King Prajadhipok ,,when he was only 9 years old In 1938, at age 13, Ananda Mahidol visited the Kingdom of Siam for the first time as monarch. On 10 December 1939, Revised the name from Siam to Thailand.

62 King Ananda Mahidol Rama VIII

He returned for a second visit in December 1945 after World War II with a degree in Law. On June 9,1946, the King was found shot dead in his bedroom in the Grand Palace only four days before he was scheduled to return to Switzerland

63 King Bhumibol Adulyadej Rama IX (1946-2016)

"We will reign with righteousness for the benefit and happiness of the Siamese people." Was born on December 5, 1927, in Cambridge, Massachusetts United States of America He was the youngest son of Prince Mahidol of Songkhla, and the direct grandson of King Chulalongkorn (Rama V), and Queen Savang. He has one older sister, Her Royal Highness Princess Galayani Vadhana of Naradhivas, and one older brother, His Majesty the late King Ananda Mahidol (Rama VIII).

64 King Bhumibol Adulyadej Rama IX Coronation

“I shall reign with righteousness for happiness and benefit of the Siamese people” His Majesty became King of the Kingdom on Thailand on 9 June 1946. The Coronation Ceremony came later on 5 May 1950 at the Royal Palace in Bangkok, after His Majesty has finalized his education in Switzerland (changing from science to politic and law), where he met the HM Queen Sirikit.

65 King Bhumibol Adulyadej Rama IX Family

King Bhumipol and Queen Sirikit have 4 children (Formerly HRH) Princess Ubolrat HRH Crown Prince Mahavajiralongkorn HRH Crown Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn HRH Princess Chulabhorn Walailak

66 King Bhumibol Adulyadej Rama IX Monkhood

Following the death of his grandmother; Queen Savang Vadhana (PhraPhanvasa Aiyeekajao King Bhumipol entered a 15 days monkhood from October – November 5,1956 at Wat Bowonniwet Vihara.

67 King Bhumibol Adulyadej King Rama IX Talents

He is a man of many talents; musician, composer, painter, photographer, engineer ,.etc. He was a sailor who won the South East Asian Penninsula Games “Gold Medal in 1967”

68 King Bhumibol Adulyadej King Rama IX

The world’s longest serving Monarch The Royal Barge Procession to celebrate the Diamon Jubilee 12 June 2006. On 9 June 2006, King and Queen appeared on the balcony of Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall with more than 100,000 Thai people were celebration. “Long Live His Majesty the King”

69 King Bhumibol Adulyadej King Rama IX Royal Project

Royal Project Foundation, Established in 1969 in the north of Thailand as originated from his majesty the kings private study to help the hill tribes to have a standard of living. Royal Rain Making Project Monkey Cheek’s Project Sufficiency Economy Etc. The Waste Water aerator “Chai Pattana” with patented in 1993

70 Present King King Maha Vajiralongkorn Bodindradebayavarangkun
